snippet: A federal judge in New York says he will lift an injunction that locked Argentina out of international markets in a long battle over defaulted debt.
abstract: Judge Thomas Griesa of United States District Court in Manhattan says he will lift injunction that has locked Argentina out of international markets; ruling weakens hand of investors, including hedge funds, in negotiating with country over defaulted debt.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge in New York says he will lift an injunction that locked Argentina out of international markets in a long battle over defaulted debt.

headline.main: Judge Deals Setback to Holdouts in Negotiations With Argentina
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Ruling Setback for Holdouts in Argentina Debt Talks
